intro: Xantolis stenosepala var. stenosepala, commonly known as the narrow-sepaled xantolis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow sepals that give it its common name. The plant typically features showy, tubular flowers that are often brightly colored, attracting pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. Its foliage is usually lance-shaped and arranged in opposite pairs along the stem. Due to its ornamental value and unique botanical features, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
